holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year’s Day is the first day of the year, or January 1, in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Epiphany
holidays.description: Epiphany is a Christian holiday celebrated globally on January 6 each year. It commemorates two events recorded in the Bible: the three wise men’s visit to baby Jesus; and Jesus’ baptism.

holidays.name: Carnival
holidays.description: Carnival is a national holiday in Andorra

holidays.name: Constitution Day
holidays.description: Constitution Day is a national holiday in Andorra

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Father’s Day celebrates fatherhood and male parenting on different dates worldwide.

holidays.name: March Equinox
holidays.description: March Equinox in Andorra (Andorra La Vella)

holidays.name: Daylight Saving Time starts
holidays.description: Daylight Saving Time starts in Andorra

holidays.name: Maundy Thursday (Starting Noon)
holidays.description: Maundy Thursday is a Christian observance on the Thursday during Holy Week. It is the day before Good Friday.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Good Friday is a global Christian observance two days before Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Holy Saturday is the day before Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday commemorates Jesus Christ’s resurrection, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: May Day
holidays.description: Labor Day, International Workers' Day, and May Day, is a day off for workers in many countries around the world.

holidays.name: Mother's Day
holidays.description: Mother’s Day celebrates the achievements and efforts of mothers and mother figures.

holidays.name: Ascension Day
holidays.description: Ascension Day is the 40th day of Easter. It is a religious holiday that commemorates the ascension of Jesus Christ into heaven.

holidays.name: Whit Sunday
holidays.description: Many Christians all over the world annually observe Pentecost, also known as Whitsunday or Whit Sunday.

holidays.name: Whit Monday
holidays.description: Whit Monday, or Pentecost Monday, is a Christian holiday that falls on the day after Pentecost, which is also known as Whit Sunday or Whitsunday.

holidays.name: June Solstice
holidays.description: June Solstice in Andorra (Andorra La Vella)

holidays.name: Assumption of Mary
holidays.description: The Christian feast of the Assumption of Mary is on or around Aug 15 in most countries. A few celebrate Assumption Day at other times of the year.

holidays.name: National Day
holidays.description: National Day is a national holiday in Andorra

holidays.name: September Equinox
holidays.description: September Equinox in Andorra (Andorra La Vella)

holidays.name: Daylight Saving Time ends
holidays.description: Daylight Saving Time ends in Andorra

holidays.name: All Saints' Day
holidays.description: Many churches honor all their saints on All Saints' Day, also known as All Hallows' Day.

holidays.name: Feast of the Immaculate Conception
holidays.description: The Feast of the Immaculate Conception is a Christian observance on December 8 each year.

holidays.name: December Solstice
holidays.description: December Solstice in Andorra (Andorra La Vella)

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve is the day before Christmas Day and falls on December 24 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christmas Day is one of the biggest Christian celebrations and falls on December 25 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Boxing Day
holidays.description: Boxing Day is a national holiday in Andorra

holidays.name: New Year's Eve (Bank holiday)
holidays.description: New Year’s Eve is the last day of the year, December 31, in the Gregorian calendar.
